detailsOfAchievement: The Performers Udaipur is the prominent theatre group of Rajasthan working in the field of theatre from last 28 years. We have organised Gawari theatre workshops, Gawari festival, Padam Shri Devilal Samar Theatre Festival from last Six years, Silver Jubilee theatre festival, theatre competitions and many theatre workshops with children and young theatre lovers. We have participated in many National theatre festivals such as BAHUROOPI-07 at Mysore, Aadharshila theatre festival Allahabad, Nehru Centre theatre festival organised by Nehru centre Mumbai, Bharat Rang Mahotsava organised by N.S.D New Delhi, Nandikar theatre Festival organised by Nandikar Kolkata, Swarn Mahotsava ad Young Directors Theatre Festival organised by Sangeet Natak Academy New Delhi, Multi-Lingual Theatre festival organised by NCZCC and N.S.D New Delhi, other National Theatre Festival organised by Zonal Cultural Centeres ZCC, Om Shiv Puri Smriti theatre festival organised by Rajasthan Sangeet Natak Academy Jodhpur(Raj.), Vivechana theatre festival organised by Vivechana Jabalpur, Experimental theatre festival organised by WZCC and Jawahar Kala Kendra Jaipur, etc. The main objective of the group is to create the atmosphere of the theatre movement and to educate the people through theatre activities. To fulfill the objectives the group is producing plays in Mewari and Hindi dialect and to appeal the rural masses. The group is working with BHEEL TRIBES of Rajasthan and Urban upcoming dedicated theatre workers.THE PERFORMERS has produced many plays in Traditional Gawari Folk Theatre form of the above mentioned BHEEL TRIBES of Mewar Region of Rajasthan.

detailsOfAchievement: Organization has been working for benefit of all the sectors of society especially minors and dalits. We are working for uplifting of working children, old persons, women & SC ST. Organization ran a composite centre for working children in need of care and protection, under the ministry of Women and child Development, New Delhi, in Rajasamand district of Rajasthan from 2008 to 2015, where annually 100 children got proper educational and vocational training to help them stand on their own feet. The basic aim of the centre was to join the participating children with the main stream. On an average, the organization admitted around 25-30 children to mainstream schools. In these schools, they are now receiving proper formal education which will help them build a good career in future. Along with the vocational and educational training, children also received training of book-binding, motor-binding, mehandi, Beauty Parlour, Electric Work, Candle Making, chalk making etc. Our organization is also operating two separate hostels for girls and boys in Sriganganagar and Srikaranpur respectively under the Ministry of Minority affairs. These hostels are home to 50 girls and 50 boys. Under the same ministry, we are also running an Old age home for 25 senior citizens at Srikaranpur, Rajasthan. Among the other major activities, we are also running a Day Care Centre with the help of Rajasthan Govt. which is operated from 11:00 am to 05:00 pm. This is a place where 25 old aged persons come for recreation, entertainment, and fun and find themselves with ready newspapers, playing cards, Television, Holy Books etc. Along with these facilities, they are also provided with one time tea and snacks. The organization is also running a Craft Training Centre under The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, New Delhi where annually 50 SC ST girls receive the training of various craft works like stitching, embroidery etc. Many of these girls are now running their own boutiques & training centres successfully. Yauwan Sanstha has also initiated a Women Awareness Program for rural and poor women to make them aware about their rights and capabilities so that they can increase their participation in society. Along with these, the Yauwan Sanstha also organized a training program for Animal Husbandry, Agriculture, fish husbandry & apiculture by trained scientists in different villages of Sriganganagar District. The organization has also kept in consideration school children by organizing a Summer Camp in K.K. Model Sec. School, Kesrisinghpur, Sriganganagar where school girls were given training of dance, Soft toys making, Mehndi, Rexene, & Candle Making etc. The Long list of various activities and achievements of the organization also includes Jaundice and disability eradication camp, Anti-Drug addiction camp, anti-foeticide campaign, child education, HIV AIDS awareness program, honouring top scorer students and various different social & cultural activities.
